newsitem.title: GERMANY: SKS Logistics Int buys Singapore forwarder.
newsitem.headline: SKS Logistics Int buys Singapore forwarder.

text.p: German freight forwarder SKS Logistics International GmbH said it has taken a 40 percent stake in Singapore-based forwarder Rhenus Transport Pte Ltd.
Gunter Jendricke, managing director of parent company Suedkraft Spedition GmbH, said in a statement: "We have already agreed to take over another 40 percent by December 31, 1997."
Rhenus Transport managing director Ricky Foo Kia Han would retain a 20 percent share in the company, the statement added.
Suedkraft said Rhenus Transport, Singapore, which specialises in air and sea freight forwarding, would continue to trade under its existing name until December 31, 1998.
Rhenus Transport generates annual revenue of some 20 million marks and employs 80 staff, the statement added.
Suedkraft is a subsidiary of Kraftverkehr Bayern GmbH, part of the German building materials group Heidelberger Zement AG.
